Body: The tools for working with BNF grammars are a little more discoverable (ANTLR, Gold, etc) and usable than for other types of grammars. What sort of sentences can't be represented with ordinary BNF grammar rules?
Title: What is an example of a syntactic structure that can't be represented by a BNF grammar?

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
I'm a programmer by day and an amateur linguist by night.

I organize the Arlington Linguistics Book Club, where we read a wide variety of books that make the science of linguistic accessible to a popular audience.
